module.name: LazUnicode
module.short: Provides encoding-agnostic Unicode string manipulation functions and an enumerator

descr.p: lazunicode.pas provides encoding-agnostic Unicode string manipulation functions and an enumerator. It works transparently with UTF-8 and UTF-16 encodings, and allows one codebase to work for:

ol.li: Lazarus using its default UTF-8 encoding
Future FPC and Lazarus versions with Delphi compatible UTF-16 encoding
Delphi compatibility where String is defined as UnicodeString

descr.remark: Behavior of helper functions are altered using the {$ModeSwitch UnicodeStrings} directive; the correct routines for handling UTF-8 or UTF-16 are called based on the mode switch value.

element.name: CodePointCopy
element.short: Copies the specified number of codepoints starting at a character position

descr.p: Copies the number of codepoints in CharCount from s, starting at the character position in StartCharIndex. For platforms that require UTF-16, UTF16Copy is called. For other platforms, UTF8Copy is called.

element.name: CodePointCopy.Result
element.short: Values copied from the string

element.name: CodePointCopy.s
element.short: UTF-encoded string values

element.name: CodePointCopy.StartCharIndex
element.short: Initial character position

element.name: CodePointCopy.CharCount
element.short: Number of characters needed in the copy operation

element.name: CodePointLength
element.short: Gets the number of codepoints in the specified string.
element.descr: Gets the number of codepoints in the specified string. For platforms that require UTF-16, UTF16Length is called to get the return value for the function. For other platforms, UTF8LengthFast is called to get the number of codepoints.

element.name: CodePointLength.Result
element.short: Number of codepoints in the string

element.name: CodePointLength.s
element.short: UTF-encoded values examined in the function

element.name: CodePointPos
element.short: Gets the position where the search value is found in a string

descr.p: Gets the position in SearchInText where SearchForText is found. StartPos indicates the initial character position (codepoint) in SearchInText used for the comparison. The default value is 1.

The return value contains the character position (codepoint) where the search value was found. The return value is 0 (zero) if SearchForText is not found in the string. For platforms that require UTF-16, UTF16Pos is called to get the return value. For other platforms, UTF8Pos is called to get the character position (codepoint).

element.name: CodePointPos.Result
element.short: Character position (codepoint) where the search value was found in the string

element.name: CodePointPos.SearchForText
element.short: Values to locate in the string

element.name: CodePointPos.SearchInText
element.short: String to search for the specified values

element.name: CodePointPos.StartPos
element.short: Initial character position (codepoint) used in the comparison

element.name: CodePointSize
element.short: Gets the number of bytes needed for a CodePoint in the specified value
element.descr: Gets the number of bytes needed for the CodePoint specified in p. For platforms that require UTF-16, TCharacter.IsHighSurrogate is called to get the return value. For other platforms, UTF8CodepointSizeFast is called to get the number of bytes for the codepoint. The return value is 1 or 2 for UTF-16-enabled platforms, or in the range 1..4 for UTF-8-enabled platforms. The return value can be 0 (zero) if p contains an empty string ('') or a malformed codepoint.

element.name: CodePointSize.Result
element.short: Number of bytes required for a codepoint

element.name: CodePointSize.p
element.short: String with the codepoint to examine in the function

element.name: IsCombining
element.short: Determines if the specified value is a combining codepoint
element.descr: Determines if the specified value is a combining codepoint. Please note, there are many more rules for combining codepoints.The diacritical marks handled in the function are only a subset of the possible Unicode values. For platforms that require UTF-16, UTF16IsCombining is called to get the return value for the specified codepoint. For other platforms, UTF8IsCombining is called to examine the codepoint.

element.name: IsCombining.Result
element.short: True when the codepoint represents a Unicode combining character

element.name: IsCombining.AChar
element.short: Codepoint to examine in the function

element.name: UnicodeToWinCP
element.short: Converts the specified value to the Windows system codepage
element.descr: Converts the specified value to the Windows system codepage. The Unicode encoding used in s depends on the modeswitch value. For platforms that require UTF-16, UTF16ToUTF8 and UTF8ToWinCP are called to get the return value for the function, except when String is defined as UnicodeString. No conversion is required in that situation. For other platforms, UTF8ToWinCP is called to get the return value.

element.name: UnicodeToWinCP.Result
element.short: Values after conversion to the Windows code page

element.name: UnicodeToWinCP.s
element.short: Unicode values to convert in the function

element.name: WinCPToUnicode
element.short: Converts the specified string to Unicode
element.descr: Converts the specified value from the Windows system codepage to Unicode. The Unicode encoding used depends on the modeswitch value. For platforms that require UTF-16, WinCPToUTF8 and UTF8ToUTF16 are called to get the return value for the function. Except when String is defined as UnicodeString. No conversion is required in that situation. For other platforms, WinCPToUTF8 is called to get the return value.

element.name: WinCPToUnicode.Result
element.short: Unicode values for the specified string

element.name: WinCPToUnicode.s
element.short: String with Windows code page values

element.name: StringOfCodePoint
element.short: Creates a string with the specified number of codepoints.
element.descr: Creates a string with the specified number of codepoints. Like StringOfChar. For platforms that require UTF-16, the values in ACodePoint are concatenated together until the number of codepoints in N have been created. For other platforms, Utf8StringOfChar is called to get the return value for the function.

element.name: StringOfCodePoint.Result
element.short: String with the specified number of codepoints

element.name: StringOfCodePoint.ACodePoint
element.short: Codepoint to use when creating the string

element.name: StringOfCodePoint.N
element.short: Number of codepoints required in the string

element.name: TUnicodeEnumeratorBase
element.descr: Base class for a Unicode character enumerator.

element.name: TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.UpdateCurrent
element.short: Copies byte values for the Current character (codepoint)
element.descr: Copies byte values used in Current for the character (codepoint) when MoveNext is called to go to the next character. aCount contains the number of byte values needed for the Unicode codepoint. UpdateCurrent increments the internal pointer used to access values in the enumerator by the number of bytes in aCount.

errors.p: Raises an assertion error if the number of bytes in aCount is 0 (zero). Raised with the message 'TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.UpdateCurrent: aCount=0'.
Raises an assertion error if the length of bytes copied to Current is different that the valuer in aCount. Raised with the message 'TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.UpdateCurrent: Length(fCurrent)<>aCount.')'.

element.name: TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.UpdateCurrent.aCount
element.short: Number of bytes needed for the codepoint

element.name: TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance
element.descr: Create initializes internal member variable used to access byte values for Unicode codepoints. A is the string with codepoints traversed using the enumerator.

element.name: TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.Create.A
element.short: Unicode string for the enumerator

element.name: TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.Current
element.short: Byte values for the current codepoint in the enumerator
element.descr: Current is a read-only String property which provides access to the byte values for the current codepoint in the enumerator. Current is updated in UpdateCurrent when the MoveNext method is called.

element.name: TUnicodeEnumeratorBase.CurrentCodeUnitCount
element.short: Number of bytes in the Current codepoint
element.descr: CurrentCodeUnitCount is a read-only Integer property which contains the number of bytes needed for the codepoint in Current. CurrentCodeUnitCount is updated in UpdateCurrent when MoveNext is called.

element.name: TCodePointEnumerator
element.short: Base class for a Unicode codepoint enumerator
element.descr: Base class for a Unicode codepoint enumerator. TCodePointEnumerator allows traversal of Unicode codepoints. Uses UTF-8 or UTF-16 encodings depending on value in $ModeSwitch. Extends the ancestor class to provide navigation in the enumerator using the MoveNext method.

element.name: TCodePointEnumerator.MoveNext
element.short: Provides navigation to the next codepoint in the enumerator
element.descr: Provides navigation to the next Unicode codepoint in the enumerator. The return value contains True when more characters (codepoints) are available to the enumerator. UpdateCurrent is called using the value from CodePointSize to store the value for the Current property.

element.name: TCodePointEnumerator.MoveNext.Result
element.short: True when more characters (codepoints) are available

element.name: TUnicodeCharacterEnumerator
element.short: Implements an enumerator for Unicode codepoints
element.descr: Implements an enumerator for Unicode codepoints. TUnicodeCharacterEnumerator allows traversal of characters (codepoints) in a Unicode-encoded string. Values use either UTF-16 or UTF-8 encoding depending on the value for $ModeSwitch. An overridden MoveNext method is provided to handle combining diacritical marks in the Unicode codepoints.

element.name: TUnicodeCharacterEnumerator.CurrentCodePointCount
element.short: Number of bytes used for the Current codepoint
element.descr: CurrentCodePointCount is a read-only Integer property that indicates the number of bytes used for the Current codepoint. CurrentCodePointCount is updated in the MoveNext method, and includes any combining diacritical marks found in the codepoints.

element.name: TUnicodeCharacterEnumerator.MoveNext
element.short: Adds support for combining diacritical marks when moving to the next codepoint

descr.p: MoveNext is an overridden method which adds support for combining diacritical marks when moving to the next codepoint for the enumerator. The return value is True when more characters (codepoints) are available to the enumerator. MoveNext updates the value in CurrentCodeUnitCount, and includes combining diacritical marks in the byte count. MoveNext calls UpdateCurrent to store the value for the Current property.
descr.remark: MoveNext does not call the inherited method.

element.name: TUnicodeCharacterEnumerator.MoveNext.Result
element.short: True when more characters (codepoints) are available to the enumerator

element.name: Enumerator
element.short: Enumerator which combines diacritical marks
element.descr: Operator that allows in For ... In loops. This enumerator combines diacritical marks. It is used by default although there are more rules for combining codepoints. Diacritical marks cover rules for most western languages.

element.name: Enumerator.Result
element.short: Enumerator for the operator

element.name: Enumerator.A
element.short: Values to traverse in the enumerator
